titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum F
United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum F
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Atula Jamir and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:07

did.unittitle: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum F
did.abstract: This record group represents a continuation of the official archives of the United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia, supplementing and overlapping the papers in record groups 11, 11A, 11B, 11C, 11D, and 11E. It provides extensive information about the institutions and projects to which the United Board lent its support. The United Board was established to support and coordinate the activities of Protestant colleges and universities in China. Following the Communist takeover of China, the United Board focused its efforts on educational work in other Asian nations. In recent years it has re-focused some of its activities on China.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum F (RG 11F), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Detailed information about the work of the United Board for Christian Higher Education during the earlier portion of the period represented by these archives is contained in Paul Lauby's book Sailing on Winds of Change: Two Decades in the Life of the United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia, 1969-1990 .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files have been maintained as sent by the United Board.
